text: wow I was just craving for spicy noodle then I found this Korean Chinese restraunt! we ordered Jajangmyun and seafood Jambbong. They could be little spicy if you couldn't usually have spicy things. But they were really good for me cuz they tasted like grilled somethings right before the fire.

First time trying this place out. We're the only ones but we came at an awkward time. The service is good. There was one server working but she was really nice. We had the lunch special. Tangsuyuk, jjajangmyun, and jjambong. My husband whos from korea says the food here is average  but satisfying. However, I, ( being a korean american) give jjajangmyun a 4 out of 5, jjambong 4 out of 5, and tangsuyuk 4 out of 5. Everything was just really good!
This place is really good. When I want to eat Jjanang, Jjampong, I always come to this place. Their food is really delicious :)
I have gone to this place many times with my friends and family, and it consistently brings great food to the table. The jajangmyeon is superb. Will eat here again.

This place probably has my favorite noodle soup! Loved it. Service is as awesome. We were seated right away and everyone was very polite. Definitely recommend getting the spicy noodle soup with seafood!

As soon as you walk in, you will be first impressed by the interior of this restaurant. Staffs are very welcoming and the food is delicious authentic Korean/Chinese. Our group was promptly greeted and the order was taken in timely manner. Also food was served fast. I liked their jjajangmyun and tangsuyuk but my favorite was jjampong! The broth was real, lots of great quality seafood and the portion is very generous. 

I live in Illinois and whenever I visit vegas area, I come here. It's pretty new but belongs to one of the largest Korean restaurant group in the area. Go eat there! You will not regret!!!!!!
This became one of my favorite korean chinese restaurant!! The service, atmosphere and the plates were great. Definately coming back!

this restaurant is one of my favorite korean chinese restaurant in the world. the soup of jjambbong taste very rich compares to one in chinatown, which is very weak. service is always nice and welcoming! i highly recommend trying jjambbong soup with chinese vodka! with side of tang soo yuk~
The white rice is fresh! The spirit is very tasty! And the service is very good! The food is good!

Excellent food!  Delicious, fresh and wonderful decor... the service was excellent!!

Order the Samsung Jia Jang Noodles and tea!!!

The music, ambiance and food is so fresh and tasty and right off the 215...

Authentic Korean Chinese

My Korean husband was very happy and excited to find an authentic Korean jajangmyeon restaurant. We have been going there at least once a week for a couple of months now for family lunch/ dinners. We went there for a late lunch and we were very disappointed. The jajangmyeon was very watered down almost like a soup .. WT? The taste was nothing like it was when we first started coming here. The food took a long time to come out and it was not even that busy. The jjampong had so much onions in it. The waitress was very nice and apologized for the wait which is not her fault. I really don't know what happened to this place that had such great food. Will most likely not come back or tell family and friends about this place. Very disappointing
Good service and food very tasty too,in the future I will bring more friends to come here try.

I like the service 
I like camping the spicy noodle and next time I will bring my family and friends come here to try.
Amazing service. Great food. We were craving jjamppong and jjajangmyun, and this place totally hit the spot. Delicious chewy noodles, flavorful broth and sauce, and ample portion sizes!
This place is amazing! Always come here for their black bean noodles, best in town. Their sizes are pretty big too, worth the prices. Love this place!

Ol the new Korean Chinese place. Had to check it out. Over all, disappointing. 
Avoid the pick hours.
Two of us had Jjajang myun and Jjamppong.
For Jjajang myun, the sauce seemed ok but the noodle... it is obvious they reheated on hot water.
Which also made the sauce watery...
I think the noodle is the basic. I would understand on pick hours but it was the slowest time of a day.
There were only two tables other than us.
The service was good. The server, a skinny girl, was very friendly.
I gotta give one more try but so far, i would rather go to the island.
This place has a beautiful ambiance. Great service and the food was really good! Worth trying this place out.

Thank you for good service. And Noodle
 burrito amazing. Should try. I recommend
Nice interior. Clean and wide inside.
CHEF'S new menu burrito was surprise tasty.
.
Service is good and there's a good variety of food to choose from bc they have korean and chinese food !
Went here during lunch special time   Had the Tangsuyuk and the Jjambbong Jjajangmyun. Not bad good service.
Good food, great service, affordable, will be back again!!! Ordered the jjajangmeon and the spicy noodles, yum!

Came to this Korean Chinese place for a while now. I've seen the disappointed reviews from other users before but my reason for 5 stars are that they've put their effort to make changes accommodating those comments. Their jjambbong is great and jaengban jjajang is great as well. I recommend trying this place out once more if you've made your mind about it before!
Great place and atmosphere! Food came quick even with a bunch of customers and was well prepared. First time here and definitely be coming back. Portions were generous.

My friend recommended this place and it didn't let down. My wife loved the hot tea and free cold dishes, but I kinda wish they gave some kimchi. The portions are huge so come with an appetite. I am a big fan of jjajangmyun so this one rated high amongst the other ones I've tried in Vegas. Tangsuyuk is also a must. The wait time was a lityle long for the jjajangmyun, but the service is exceptional and friendly, so it made up for that. I will be back!

good service n good food !!!
Jjajangmyun is the best !!
and bul jjampong as well.
everyone is super friendly
you must check this place

First time I be here. I ordered Kkangpung saewu, fried mushroom rice, jjajang mein, and  jjambong. It taste not bad but not outstanding also. Kkangpung saewu tempura batter too thick and dark. It looks fried by old oil. Only fried mushroom rice taste good.

I should trust my instincts... one year later we decided to give this place another go.. to my dismay i was sorely disappointed once again. i will not eat here ever again. The staff is not apologetic nor accommodating, and they ought to decide if they're chinese or korean restaurant. Serving Jjampong without noodles is a crime! The owner needs to retrain the staff how to be courteous.

Nice food and environment! Our two waitresses were really nice checking us every now and so. I came with my friend and he had a pleasant time as well. Thank you for a nice Sunday evening meal! I would definitely stop by again next time. Recommend!

We were really excited to come and try this place. We normally eat at Goong Koran BBQ next door but this time we decided to try it out. We walked in and we were seated in a cute little booth. The place was pretty empty and the service started out nice. The busser brought us our waters and their little apps. And that was the last time we were helped by anyone. Soon after a rowdy party of 8 came In followed by a party of 4 and a party of 2. All of them got service and placed their orders before anyone even came back to us. We contemplated leaving but figured we'd give them another minute. A minute goes by and still nothing so we get up and leave to head to Goong next door. On our way out we pass the server who doesn't say a word to us. At least we know we'll get a good meal for sure at Goong tonight.

Pretty dank oyster jjamppong and jjajangmyeon. We came in here not really expecting much since it's like the only legit korean chinese cuisine that has jjajangmyeon in Vegas. It pretty much exceeded our expectations and left quite satisfied. I will be coming back next time. One suggestion might be on their jjajangmyeon that we came in for, it might be better if theres a little sweetness to it

Cute decor and friendly service!!  The jajangmyeon was delicious!  I will definitely be going back there anytime I need a jajangmyeon fix.  They give you kitchen shears to cut the long noodles.  I had never been to a place that did that before, but oddly enough it made the dish feel even more homemade and fresh.  Good experience!

The interior is so beautiful and the overall atmosphere is nice and peaceful. I had to drive all the way to Sahara just to eat some black bean noodles but now that this restaurant is here I only have to drive 10 minutes. The food tasted amazing too! I would give this restaurant a 5 star if only their service was faster.
Probably the best decision I've made! Friend and I were craving some good jjajang myeon after our flight (from Dallas) and this place hit the spot!!! Tangsuyuk is on point too! Must try!!!

if youre looking for an asian fusion meal. this is the place! they serve korean/chinese dishes that wow'd me fron the first bite.( they also offer anerican/chinese dishes too)  i ordered jjampong soup because i love alittle bit of spice and it nailed my expectations. the broth and the amount of seafood in the bowl is perfect for a quiet lunch for 1. the ambience is really beautiful. edison light blubs, partition rooms for privacy, also nice dining room. ny server was excellent at recommending and taking care of my table. i would recommend this place to anyone! they also speak korean too.
Everything was delicious, we didn't expect to find a Chinese Korean restaurant at this level of quality.
Ordered japchae rice n jjampong. Both were delicious. Wish little bit less sugar in the japchae and little bit less salt in jjampong. Overeall, it was good.
Very good place for noodles! There are many vegetables and meat in the noodles. The size is also able to make you feel very full.

Came here with a few friends for dinner. We were seated right away for a table of 5. This place serves Korean Chinese, meaning not authentic Chinese food but Korean styled Chinese food. 

Food: 
Jaengban Bokkeum Jjamppong (5 stars) comes with jumbo shrimp, squid and other assorted seafood along with noodles. Broth is fairly spicy even though they ask if you if you'd like it extra spicy, I think the regular spice way spicy enough. Good flavor and quite large size. You could probably get 5-6 small bowls out of this dish.

Jaengban Jjajang- (5 stars) I would especially recommend this dish. We got the extra large size and there was quite a bit. This dish is made with some seafood, pork, veggies and black bean. Sauce with noodles were absolutely delicious!! Favorite dish of the night.

Steamed dumplings (4 stars) - nothing special but good dish nonetheless. I believe this dumpling is made with pork and vegetables. 

Baby bokchoy (5 stars)- good dish and very good portion. The thing I look for when I eat this dish is that it the bokchoy is very clean and does not have any sort of dirt near the stem. Looked at the pieces I ate and they looked pretty good! (You can tell I eat a lot of Asian veggies) 

Tang su yuk (5 stars)- very good fry on this dish!!you could tell the oil was very fresh and the fry on the breading was done right. Highly recommend this di

Overall great spot and would definitely come here again!

I've been here twice and while I won't say it's the best Chinese place I've had, it's one of the better in Vegas. It's especially nice that it's so close to home for me.

I've had the regular jja jang myun and the seafood jja jang myun. I think I prefer the regular. The seafood one was a bit bland for me. The fried dumpling is delicious... and I also tried the garlic (?) chicken (kkanpungi) and that was also pretty good.

On this last visit their a/c was down and ... it was not pleasant considering it was over 100 degrees outside. Regardless food was still good, despite sweating and eating. 

If you're into spicy food, the fire jjam bbong is pretty spicy. It's more on peppery side, but beware... I only took a sip of the soup but my friend said although good, you may pay for it the next day

Great service, tasteful decor, and delicious food, what more could you ask for? Tried their Kung Pao Chicken, very well made, as well as their crab meat corn soup, also very tasty. Will definitely be back for more!
Overall I got the sense that they really cared about their restaurant guests, decor, and food.
Jjajang noodle + sweet & sour pork is my favorite! Totally recommended for lunch and casual dinner! Great customer service.

Best Korean-chinese restaurant in Las Vegas. 
I really like their lunch special available till 4pm.
Super recommend this place!.

I am a returning customer and they never disappoint. The jjajangmyun here is great and the place is really aesthetic and clean. Perfect place for grabbing a good bite with friends or family. EDIT: I came here for the  and it was really good.
I love this place. Great service and awesome lighting! I was not disappointed with the spicy seafood, very delicious.

We were driving from CA to AZ and was craving for Korean Chinese food. We found this place through Yelp, were hungry, so ordered Jjamppong, Jjajangmien, fried gyoza, kkanpunggi, and Japchaebop. We were two adults and one 3 year old boy but we finished most of it! Definitely would come  back to this place!
Food and service were great! I definitely recommend the black bean noodles, chicken wings and mapo tofu - all had great flavor. Can't wait to come back again
finally found my jja jang spot in vegas!!!  good service and good food!!  best part, my daughter loved it

I have mixed feelings about this place...
Tried this place twice and it was a polar opposite experience between the two trips. 
Both times I ordered the jjajangmyuen, the classic, nothing added. 

First time it was absolutely amazing. I was shocked I haven't discovered this place sooner. It was the closest to the authentic korean kind you'd get from the homeland. The noodles were fresh, the sauce wasn't pasty, it did take some time for them to bring the food out, but well worth the wait. 

The second time it was the exact opposite...maybe it was because I ordered a large rather than the small...? But that shouldn't hinder the quality. This time around, the jjajang sauce was not runny at all. It was thick AF. 
The kind of thick you'd expect it to be seeing it in the fridge as leftovers a couple days after. Not pleasant at all :(  they didn't even have kimchi as a banchan either. 

They say third time is the charm, but I'm pretty remorseful after that second trip....
The plaza has TONS of good choices, I'd probably visit SOYO before going here again :)
Finally a korean chinese cuisine in vegas! Came in with no expectation, turnt out pretty good! I love their jjamppong and jjjajangmyeon! This is my second time coming back yay!

The service was great but I wasn't a huge fan of the food. The jjajangmyun wasn't what I was used to growing up a little lackluster predominant flavors and slightly bland. Personal opinions aside, I would still give it a try.

Great place for Korean Style Chinese Cuisine! Not too expensive and great service from staff. I ordered the Black Bean Noodles special and it was fantastic! Highly recommended for those who love Korean Style cuisine!

My Korean noodle knowledge is admittedly lacking, but some of my Asian friends were lured in here by their social media marketing. Long noods for long life, yo! The service was very attentive and it's a good value (huge portion sizes!) but the food itself didn't do it for me.

Jjajangmyeon is their specialty (black bean noodle with pork) and the sauce was bland and one note, I've have had better elsewhere. They brought scissors to cut the noodles, but that was unnecessary as they kept breaking off and were short. No cool noodle lift photos for us.

The Samseong Jjamppong (spicy seafood and vegetables) was a bit better, but the table was in agreement that the spicy sauce just tasted spicy without a developed flavor. Same issue with the noodles, broke easily and just weren't very chewy. Prefered this soup for the seafood.

Maybe they have consistency issues, or maybe I'm just not a fan of their food. Would come back if a friend suggested it, but would try other dishes. These didn't live up to the hype.
Really nice ambience but the food werent that special. Not enough side dishes too... compared to other places.
This place has awsome. Nice decorate, awsome taste food, and frendily server. I love to visit here when i want to eat korean chinese dish. Their noddle item is delicious every time i visted
I found this restaurant last month. Since crazy about this noodle  basically all noodle is so good and I really Love this Kolian noodle !!!!! I wish this restaurant is near my house

Had a late Father's Day dinner here last night. Just so happened that they also started serving happy hour from 9pm-1am. Man, what an extra treat. Frist off, I have been here multiple times before. My family and I LOVE everything about this place. The ambience, the decorations, the spacious settings and the unique hole in the wall asian dining experience. The servings are huge, exactly how our family needs it to be since we always eat family style. The service has always been great (crossing fingers that it doesn't EVER go sour). Most importantly, the food is AMAZING!! Great authentic taste of Asian cuisine. Anyways, I happen to love it here. I hope this place continues to grow!

I've ordered Togo before and was amazed enough to come have a sit down meal here! I'm not very familiar with Korean Chinese, but luckily there's an American Chinese menu that fits me very well!!!

The seating seems to be traditional and not necessarily comfortable because the table hangs too low to have your legs fit under.

I've been looking for a Korean/Chinese restaurant since the restaurant that I went to in Chinatown closed. So I was super duper excited to see what this place had opened up!!  But I was a little disappointed. :(

The service was not quite up to par... Don't get me wrong the service was what you would get in Korea... Where you had to flag down your server by yelling across the dining room... But in the US... That doesn't really fly.... You know? The server was nice and answered all the questions I had but I had to crane my neck the entire time I was there and try to make eye contact multiple times just to get the check. But to his credit.... It looked like he was the only one taking orders????? There were 2 other ladies there but they just seem to refill water and bring out food. :/ They might need to rethink this. 1 server for that dining area is not enough.  (2/5)

Ambiance... Whoa! This place is definitely bigger then I expected when I walked in. It was huge! I didn't get the see the private rooms or the dining area in the back of the room... But it is definitely bigger then expected! The entrance way was a little dark but the rest of the dining room was very bright. Most of the dining area was painted white with the left side of the dining area being a bright red. It was very clean and the space was very open. Ambiance definitely 5/5

Food... And drink....I asked for barley tea and was told that they only had Jasmine tea... It was served in a cute little pot with a tiny glass... Tea was decent but I really would've liked barley tea. The side dishes or banchan were ok. It was Kim chi made with American cabbage instead of Napa cabbage... This was actually really good and had a great texture. The other dish was raw onions and the traditional yellow pickled daikon served with the black bean sauce who happens to be one of my favs. :) But that was it. Maybe in the future they will have more??? I ordered the deep fried dumplings and that was good. The skin was crispy and the filling was meaty and juicy. And they have vinegar, soy sauce and fine ground chili flakes on the table to make your own sauce for the dumplings. I just wished they had the black vinegar as I think it tastes better then the normal white vinegar for these types of dumplings. 4/5 

I also ordered the jja-jang-myun. The price was decent... It was only $6.95 for the small. This was done more the Korean way instead of the Chinese way which is what I was expecting since most of the pictures they had displayed the Chinese version. The flavor was ok. It was tad sweet for me and I didn't get the porky flavor that I was expecting as well. The noodles were also over cooked as they were very very soft and had no mouth feel. They also need to tighten up the sauce a little as after I was done picking out all the noodles, the sauce was completely soupy which it definitely should not be. 2/5

Overall, I think based off of the dishes that I ordered today that they lean more towards the Korean way of cooking things then the Chinese which was a little disappointing. But since I normally drive all the way to Island Style to get my jja-jang-myun fix...I most likely will be back as this place is only 5 minutes from the house. I'm hoping that they fix the service and fix the jja-jang-myun. Next time I come, I definitely will try something different.

***Tip... Pour extra vinegar onto the daikon and the onions and dip it into the black bean sauce and enjoy!  :)
First time trying this place and absolutely loved it! We ordered samsun Jjambbong and samsun jja jang myun, they were both very good. The best korean-chinese restaurant in vegas!
Regular jangbong is delicious. Black bean paste noodle is good too. We like to come here once a week just to get some Chinese noodles

Was really excited to try the black bean noodles they have, saw it in plenty of Korean dramas but have never had it so really wanted to try. The place is very nicely decorated, clean, and is spacious, lots of tables. We came in around 12:30, were immediately seated...everything went downhill from there. We sat there for about 15 minutes, no one else greeted us or even brought us water. Then the waitress came by and took our order...then they brought out kimchi and pickled veggies and we still didn't get water. 

My brother got seafood fried rice which he thought was ok, I thought it was too wet, only a few  baby shrimps and two pieces of muscles and its considered "seafood" fried rice. My sister got the rice with pork and vegetables which was pretty good. We ordered dumplings as appetizers which came out after the fried rice and the rice bowl. I got the black bean noodles with pork which never came out! I waited and waited, then asked for it and the guy told me they "forgot to make it." So I cancelled it. I will say that the fried rice and the rice bowl came out super quick...the food that we did get didn't take long to come out at all. 

I don't think they have bad service in the sense that the staff were lazy or incompetent, I think they are extremely understaffed. They only had three people working and had a pretty decent number of tables, so I can see that they are working hard. I hate to give them only two stars but for a place that is new they should have more staff and give the best service so people will spread the word. 

For this particular experience I was extremely disappointed. We were not given good service, waited quite a while for our order to be taken, waited a long while for water and water was not re-filled, they forgot my order, and the rest of the food was not impressive. 

I might go back in a few months when they have been open for a while and operation should be more smooth because I really want to try the black bean noodles, but nothing else draws me back to this place.

Not a terrible experience, but not outstanding either. I'm a fan of Korean and Chinese food, so we were excited to give YuXiang a try. Unfortunately, the food and service only deserve 3 stars. 

The japchae was slightly mushy and literally had an entire onion in it. I don't mind onion, but this was way too much. There was a tiny amount of other veggies. The flavor was okay, but not anything like traditional japchae.

The Mongolian beef was good. Tender and cooked well. The chicken fried rice was also pretty good. But neither were memorable.

The jajangmyun was a little soupy, flavor was okay, but again, nothing special. 

We also ordered mandoo (which didn't have any sauce). Our total came to $57.

We sat down soon after arriving and a server brought us complimentary hot tea and ice water. They don't offer free refills on soda/iced tea (served in cans) which is a pet peeve of mine. Overall service was okay, not great but not awful. 

Parking is also an issue here. There are 3 restaurants, a Dairy Queen and a few other businesses all sharing a small parking lot. 

In my opinion, when you consider the price, quality of both food and service, along with the inconvenient parking situation, I don't see myself coming back.
Great service and great food! Nice interior! You should try their Jjampong !! This is one of my favorites!!!!

Love the Chinese Korean fusion. The Chinese chicken wings is the bomb. First time eating the bean paste noodle dish- ow wow so yummy.  
Other dishes are spot on.  
Service is great.  Very clean compare to restaurants in Spring mountain.

Chinese Korean style.
Jjampong which is Spicy seafood soup with noodle or rice is just awesome, my favorite! 
Service was good as always.
I will definitely go back again and again for the spicy seafood soup!

Every time I go, the owner chef explains new ideas, trying so hard to provide best taste ever.

Thank you.

Food: Good
Price: Good
Service: Good
Parking: Good
This place is so yummy! I love the vegetable black bean noodles and steamed buns. The service is great and everyone is so kind with a smile! Coming back ASAP.

Was so happy to find a Korean Chinese place in Las Vegas.  Just moved fr SFlorida, where I haven't been able to get good ccha jang myun for 17 yrs!

I got the lunch special w tang su you & upgraded black bean noodles.  I loved the sweet & sour sauce on the side so the meat could stay crispy.  The vinegar took my breath away at first, which reminded me of Korea when I was little:)  

The seafood cha jang myun tasted good but too much onions and not enough seafood...but overall delish!

Gourmet food won't taste good without proper presentation.

The service was mediocre but it could be because it's a new business.

The taste was good.  We had TANGSUYUK, the most popular in Korean Chinese foods but 

as I mentioned above, the small and not looking nice plate ruined the taste. (taste was good) 

People enjoy gourmet food  with both eye and mouth so we are trying to go better restaurant 

expecting they serve looking good food without sacrificing taste.

Furthermore, the quantity was not enough for $17.

I don't know who is a manager but somebody who looked a manager was busy to talk to his

 friends .  If I were a manager, I will greet all customers and try to listen their opinion.

The role of a manager cannot be overemphasized. 

I think this place was just opened so it would be better as time goes on because the owner has showed very impressive success in other restaurants . 

 I will visit again and leave new review.

Whenever I crave for Jjajangmyun, I always come here because it's not only cheap but also big portion!! They also offer a wide variety of food, too. Not to mention that their interior is so pretty. It makes me feel like I'm in China

The Goods
1. Specialize in Korean/Chinese style of cooking including jyajyang myun, chanpon sea spicy noodle, Chinese dishes like beef broccoli and walnut shrimp, and mandoo/potsticker dumpling 
2. Couple drinks like sake and beer

Service
1. I loved my service here, the server invited me to sit down and offered me a drink!  
2. The preparation of my To go order was so quick!  

Ambiance
1. I think it is quite beautiful compared to other jyajyang myun style restaurants, modern lamps and a Chinese flair!  I'd definitely go back because it was welcoming and comfortable 

MoJo
1. I took the food to go/takeout and it was still good when I got home.  Not piping hot but you just have to mix the sauce with the noodle!  It is more like an udon noodle than what I've had as a child, thinner skinny noodle kind of like ramen.  I got the yaki mandoo and the flavor was good.  Smaller than when I was a kid but still yum!  It comes with pickled radish, kimchi, and raw onion.  This is a very unique style of Korean Chinese cuisine so it may not be everyone's taste but growing up eating it - it really hit the spot!  I definitely plan to go back and hope and pray that it'll stay put !
Food is always really good! Service is great! Must try Korean Chinese restaurant in Las Vegas!

The food was good I tried one of the Korean specialty dishes at suggesting with pork and mushrooms I was disappointed that it was mostly other vegetables and very little pork and mushrooms for almost $20 you could've said that it was something different than what it actually was. Overall it was good but I'm not sure if I order again for the value factor

The best noodles ever 
I love it 
You should try it !!! 
Can't wait to comeback 
Highly recommend 
Great service

the first time I experienced this restaurant, i called in for a take out. my friends and I ordered jampong, jjajjangmyun, and half and half. After we picked it up and came home, it seemed like they gave us only 2 handful of noodles ( for jjajjangmyun and jampong). So basically, we didn't get noodles for our half (rice) and half(jampong). ;( disappointed. 

so if you order take out, double check. 

food was alright. a bit pricey for the amount you get.

The food is pretty good but the service is excellent! The waitresses there are so friendly and smiley. We always feel really good leaving there. The kimchee (non Spicy) was recently added to the menu (free side dish) and it is addicting!! I have to get my fix at least every other week. If you're into super super spicy, I'm talking spicy ramen challenge type of spicy, you must try the bul-jjampong. It's fire! But also addicting. And of course the star is the jjajangmyun. If you haven't tried it, go try it.

Black bean noodles! Most Korean restaurants surprisingly do not have this on the menu, so my girlfriend and I were stoked to see it. Have been coming here ever since they opened last year. Will come back!
Super late breakfast/lunch. Super spicy jjampong, seafood jjajangmyeon, and fried mandoo appetizers. Everything was delicious.

The restaurant design is good, foods are ok, but I think I'm not going back.
I visited here because I love Korean food and the Korean style Chinese food sounds pretty attractive to me, so I drove about 25 min and I recommend my friend to try out this place with me since it just open, but once we walk in, the dirty dishes are all over the place, and the table inside of the rooms are messy and dirty, no single waiter/waitress seems want to pick it up and send it to the back, it is so disgusting! I feel so embarrassed and nonstop apologizing to my friend.

Easily the best Jjajangs and Jjamppongs in town, YuXiang offers these and other classic Korean Chinese dishes in a lovely setting! If you already like Jjajangs and Jjamppongs, then suffice it to say, you NEED to make your way to YuXiang, if you haven't already, for the best Korean Chinese food in town.

I first had Jajangmyen at an elevated Korean fusion restaurant several years ago and have loved it ever since.  Prior to this experience, I didn't know that Korean Chinese Cuisine was even a thing, but in the same way that we have bastardized Chinese food in America (or should I say it has been bastardized here) based on available ingredients, and the pallets of the nationals, the same divergence happened long ago in Korea. There are only a few places in town that specialize in Korean Chinese Cuisine, and YuXiang is not only the tastiest, but also provides the best atmosphere by a long way.

If you haven't had the opportunity to taste Korean Chinese dishes there are a couple of gateway dishes that are highly reminiscent of American Chinese options: Tangsuyuk (sweet and sour pork or beef) and Kkanpunggi (spicy garlic fried chicken)...we shared both of these as appetizers on separate occasions with friends or family we came with. 

The real standouts for me are the previously mentioned classics though: Jjajang and Jjamppong. I usually get the Samseon Gan Jjajang without the pork, because I love seafood, but try to limit my pork intake. The dish is $11 and it hits the spot! I love the thick rich taste of the black bean sauce. Highly recomended. My love likes it spicy and orders one of the Jjampongs, typically the extra spicy Bull Jjamppong or the seafood Samseon Jjamppong. The extra spicy is just that...extra spicy, while the Samseon Jjamppong is a great way to enjoy some seafood in a more approachable spicy broth. While a little more adventurous, Jjamppong is certainly worth trying for all but those with the narrowest pallets.

There are even some American Chinese dishes available if you aren't down with broadening your horizons, but these are not the dishes I make the drive across town to enjoy.

In the end, YuXiang is the absolute best in town...so I could be inclined to pass out 5 stars, but i don't want to get your expectations any higher than they need to be. If you aren't looking specifically for Korean Chinese food, then YuXiang is a very solid 4 stars...and if you are specifically looking for Korean Chinese food, then YuXiang is the beginning and end of the story in Vegas.
Came for lunch special! Order lunch special combination #6.  Simple and good! Worth to try lunch special! But service took long time!
Very tasty and REAL Korean-Chinese food. I would say its the best one in Vegas. We had a quality family time here.
Last time we tried their extra spicy jangbong and it was way too spicy. Today we came here and would like to try their regular jangbong. Oh we like their side dish. Chinese style cabbage kimchi.
Good food and nice environment! I'll definitely come back again next time, server also very helpful and nice

Great atmosphere, staff were so nice and helpful. This was our first time at a Korean restaurant and we were not disappointed. All the dishes came in large portions. I will note that the spicy dishes are very spicy so be forewarned, but so delicious! Happy hour from 9pm to 1 am. Definitely check it out if you are considering visiting :)

We didn't know until after we had already ordered that this place was close to closing time. When that is the case in most places, they turn you away with a quickness. Not the staff at this restaurant! They were nice and very accommodating.

The atmosphere when you walk in the door was very calm and relaxing. The music of choice (Korean pop/top 40) was a brilliant touch. 

The food didn't take too long to come out, which initially concerned me. That quickly went away the moment I had the first bite of my food. Dinner was delicious! I actually want to know how they made the bowl I ate (I can't pronounce it....it was all veggies....mushrooms and rice). 

Overall, I wok be returning to this place! I HIGHLY recommend this for all Korean food lovers!
The atmosphere is excellent, staffs are very welcoming and friendly. The place seems to be very clean and our side dishes and food come out very quickly. Excellent service.

I went to the place and ordered JJAMPONG. And When my husband eat the JJAMPONG something strange in his mouth. It was washing dish loofar. I complained but the server said sorry and there is only thing they can do is not charging for JJAMPONG. Do i have to be happy with free food? What i want was seeing the manager and apology with right way.  
I requested to talk to manager and he hardly came to our table and told us like " We wash the wok with steel wool.Perhaps It is." This is the most terrible thing. He should have show up and apologized  before i requested. Also we can't eat other food anymore. We paid without JJAMPONG.

Ordered deep fried pork with garlic and chili it was awesome i had some seafood soup as well overall great my server was great on explaining some o the dishes i was asking about will come back again and tell friends and family !!!

There's not many places that sell jjajangmyun around the area. I came in excited to try it out! The decor of this place is very interesting and nicely decorated to fit the theme of the culture. The waiter was helpful and made sure to answer any questions that we might have.

I ordered a large jjajangmyun and wow was it a large portion! I'd say it's a good amount to feed two people for $9! It tastes as good as it looks too! I was also given two side dishes of kimchi and another plate of onions and yellow daikon. It was pretty neat how they offered complimentary Jasmine tea (hot or iced) unlike most places that would charge you.
This is my first time here but the jjajangmyeon here is really good! The staff is also very friendly and checked on us often. I would definitely come back for more! :)
The tea was good! Ban chan was good too! Review to be continued. Good noodles. Fresh seafood. We've been wanting to try this out! Will be back :)

If you are a noodle lover, add YuXiang Korean Chinese Cuisine to your list!

Located at Rainbow and Robindale, the mecca of Vegas' new Little China Town, It's certainly appropriate to have a Korean-Chinese restaurant...especially when you consider that this is the best on a short list of Korean-Chinese restaurants in Las Vegas. I grew up in Korea, but I've been a resident of Las Vegas for almost two decades now and YuXiang has instantly become my one and only spot for Jjamppong and Jjajangmeon, for me since they opened. I first saw their pictures from THE Philip T's feed and WOW!!!  I was hooked to come in and try for myself.

The staff is young and professional...most of them speak both English and Korean.  If you are not sure about what to order, they will give you great suggestions....but the menu is well manufactured with pictures of the dishes, so it's easy to make a decision. If you like it a little spicier, chef Lim will do that for you...if you like more seafood, no pork, chef Lim will do that for you. Chef often comes out to say hello, so if you see him don't forget to say hi back.

Let's talk about Jjamppong. The broth is packed with flavor, the noodles are cooked to perfection...chewy, thick, and long....they don't break like many others. I normally get Seafood Jjamppong...tons of seafood, just the way I like.

If you need more noodle or sauce, just ask them...the friendly staff will accommodate your likings. 

There is hot tea, Soju, and even Chinese liquor available if you want to cool down your tongue. 

If you haven't been yet, then make it a point to come down and try this well decorated and well staffed delicious Korean-Chinese option! 

- 2018 review #3-

I love this restaurant. Kind and nice servers and clean and nice foods. I always go to here for Zzam-bbong. I tried to eat Hot Zzam-bbong  to burn streses today. If u like super spicy noodle, just try. It will burn ur all stresses and some minds... Anyway, nice hot. And they have  rooms too. Sometimes, u want to be drunken just with little friends in silence. Without people's eyes. It will certainly isolate you from the world. Good foods, good friends or good someones, Chinese alcohols. Why not? Just try.
this is the good korean chinese style food in town?have a good service and good food,interior decoration have the Chinese feel?is good to eat

Best jjajangmyeon in town! Well, to me at least! Friendly and helpful staff. Love the decor and ambiance...feels like you're somewhere in China. My husband ordered jjajangmyeon and I ordered jjampong and both were delicious!! The noodles were perfect, soup-tasty. Never cared for jjajangmyeon before but this place made me wanting more! Black bean sauce was mmm so gooOoood! Even my 16 month old enjoyed it!! Generous portions! I definitely will be back!!!
This place Jjambbong is awesome place i ve came from LA but this is way better place so please come check out and jjambbong is very spicy so be careful but I love all food here
Great service. Waitress explained the entrees and helped us find what we wanted. The food was good also. Mongolian beef was delish
This place has the best korean-chinese food in all over vegas. I recommend ordering jjajangmyun from this place. Very nice service as well
Great Korean Chinese restaurant. I tried stir fried jjambbong rice, jjajang& fried rice and tangsuyook and all three dishes were really good. I like this place better than the other one at Sahara.

Extreme long wait time. Food is decent. Noodles need more firmness. Service is fine but too many apologies for delays. Will try one more time and see if this is normal. For those who have not tried this type of Chinese cuisine, it is different from the prevalent Canton food available in the States. This is closer to Shandong style food as many who emigrated to Korea and opened restaurants were from Shandong.
Ja jang was just ok .... I wish the sauce had more Meat. Also wasn't given my change when I left with my takeout !
This is probably the best korean chinese restaurant in vegas. I love jja jang myun and jjam bbong. I probably wont recommend for mapotofu. But must try tangsooyook! Im definitely coming back :)

The black bean sauce pork went great with the white noodles. The service was a little slow if you don't mind taking your time. Also the pickled cabbage and what ever fruit or vegetable was pickled as well made a great starter

Interior of restaurant was very pleasant 
I ordered four dishes - mando, jaegban jjajang, gochu japchae, yangjangpi 

Mando - pork and chives inside it was good but portion was small

Jaegban jjajang - not good. No taste at all. Noodle it self was horrible 
Gochu japchae - not much meat just full of onions and bell pepper also sauce was too sweet

Yang jang pi- it was ok fresh ingredient but sauce was too sweet i feel like they use honey mustard for the sauce 

three stars for the service and environment. I will not go back.  if they cannot make good jjajang noodle its failure  for Chinese korean restaurant

Pro tip: Come hungry, portions are huge!!

Ordered a samseon jjamppong (spicy seafood noodle soup) and a samseon gan jjajang (seafood pork and veggies in black bean sauce).  The jjampong broth was delicious!!  The bowl was humungous as well.  The samseon gan jjajang was equally delicous.  So much seafood piled into my bowl.  The food was very good, definitely as good as what you'll find in k-town LA!!  I dined with my mom, and she loved both dishes as well.  When a Korean mom says it's good, you know it's good.  Can't argue with mom!!

The service was really good.  The waitress greeted us as we came in and was very courteous.  Without us asking, she brought 2 extra small bowls because she knew we were going to share.  Also, it seems like the staff is bilingual in Korean and English.  I'm unsure if anyone spoke any Chinese dialect.  

I really want to give this place 5 stars, but I hate the tables and chairs.  I found the chairs to be too high in relation to the height of the table.  Around the bottom of the tables is a decorative piece that I kept bumping my legs into.  I found this to be very annoying.  

Overall, I loved the food and found the prices to be very cheap.  Most likely I'll get a to-go order on my next visit so I don't have to deal with the tables and chairs.  But other than that, a very welcome addition to the Southwest area of town.  I am very very very glad to have such a good new restaurant in my neighborhood!!
This place is sooooo adorable. The decor is awesome and the foooooood looks amazing. Ordering right now and the service is great!

I wouldn't say that I'm a Korean-Chinese cuisine connoisseur per se, but I've had a lot of jjamppong (spicy seafood noodle soup) and jjajangmyun (black bean noodles) in my days where I can distinguish the good ones from the bad ones. The good ones probably use a lot of MSG tho.

When I first heard about YuXiang, I was so excited that there was going to be a legit Korean-Chinese restaurant here in Vegas, and when I tried YuXiang for the first time, I was pretty impressed with their food. Their jjambbong and jjajangmyun were solid (generous portions of noodles, vegetables, and seafood and flavorful jjambbong broth) along with their tangsuyuk (sweet and sour crispy pork) and kkanppong saewoo (sweet and spicy deep fried shrimp). 

However, I returned a couple times after that, and the food was wildly inconsistent. Once, the jjambbong soup had no flavor and hardly any seafood in it. Another time, the tangsuyuk was way overcooked, and the batter to meat ratio was all batter, hardly any meat. I also feel like the quality of their food has dropped significantly since their debut. Not sure if they changed chefs or not but please try to keep the food consistent!

Service has always been good tho so props to all the servers.

Good food and decent service. The tables and chairs are a little uncomfortable. Also, they provide free ice cream if you write a yelp review, which is what I am doing right now so please don't take my review seriously. Ok and it needs to be a certain length to be considered a review so I am going to ramble a bit on just to get my free ice cream. K thanks
The best!! Literally the restaurant is sooo cute with the Chinese theme. One of the most authentic places I've been to for . Totally recommend

Great place if you're in the Vegas area and craving some good Korean Chinese food. Come for the Ja Jiang Mien and spicy seafood noodle soup. They have different kinds of the ja jiang mien; gan vs regular, seafood and non seafood.
This is one my favorite korean chinese restaurant! They have best noodles in Vegas! Also I love their fried dumplings. Go and try it!

Fair prices and quick service.  I came for lunch and although I didn't partake, they offered some nice lunch deals with 2-3 dishes for under $20.  At Yu XIang, though, the portion size is very generous so this is a steal and a meal for the next day.  I opted for the jajangmyeon small portion.  I was easily full for about $7.50.  Couple this with a few banchan of radish and cabbage and onion, and the meal was great.  The entree was a little plain with just paste and noodle and small portions of meat and greens, but tasty nonetheless.  All in all, the meal was really good and service was quick and no nonsense.  The tables aren't the best for tall people though as they drop pretty low.    Yu Xiang offers soju and other drinks so it can be a family meal or a late night destination.  Either way, a nice, different, option in the food-centric plaza.

We tried to come in on Sunday night. However, after waiting a good amount of time to even be greeted, they told us their kitchen was backed up. That's completely fine since it was newly opened but I don't like waiting in an area looking like a dummy and being ignored just because you had bad news to give me. I know they saw us but didn't bother to acknowledge we were there to just say hold a moment. Just ignored us until they told us they had a 40 minute wait. Anyways, came in on Monday for lunch. 

We got the mapo tofu, pork fried rice, jajangmyeon, and the fried dumplings. Mopo tofu was disappointing. Mapo tofu is known for that numbing spiciness. It didn't have any sign of that. Meh. 

The jajangmyeon was the best of what we ordered and it was the cheapest thing we ordered. It is a bit on the sweeter side. But it was weirdly inconsistent. My friend got the same thing and his sauce was thick while mine ended up watery. I'm not sure if its just because I eat slower or not. 

Fried rice was supposed to have pork in it but somehow there was no pork? I'm not really sure what happened to that dish there. 

Fried dumplings were yummy so I can't really complain about these. I don't think you can really go wrong with those anyways. However, dumplings cost more than the noodles. I don't really quite understand that.

Anyways, I would come back but only to try the other Korean dishes and give them another shot because I REALLY want to like them. But I'll wait till they get things more organized.

Great food and service. I love their Jjampong and blackbean sauce noodle. 
I will definitely come back here for try others!!

Great food and service!!

I've got Tangsuyuk + 1 Jjajangmyun + 1 Jjambbong as a lunch combo, and Yangjangpi also.
For the lunch combo, Tangsuyuk is half portion.
Jjajangmyun has been upgraded to Samsun Jjajangmyun by $1.00. Love it!!
Tangsuyuk is super crispy and it's sauce was sweet and sour!!
Yangjangpi is my favorite food of Chinese-Korean fusion restaurant, and it was super great!

Additionally, service was awesome!!

Definitely I'll come back!!

Love this place

I've had this place booked marked for a very long time.  I've been in search of Jjajangmyun and this place hit the spot!  I could eat three bowls of jjajangmyun! The wonton soup was really good too, just right! The servers were really nice to me and my brother! Well...they could count on me coming back again!

A very good Korean style Chinese restaurant. Love the  interior with accent and detailed design. The food is good. Good spicy noodle and black noodle. The owner is also very kind and funny. Definitely recommend~
Cant wait! Finally a korean chinese place!!! We ordered so much so excited!!! We love chinese korean food and now were going to try it!!! Jaja jang myun and jjam ppong and tang su yuk is a must.

My daughter and I ordered the jjajangmyun. There was barely any sauce in it. So I politely asked fir more sauce. They said it would cost extra. I was fine with it. It never came. My wife ordered the jjampong, it also never came. We asked later for it and they apologized and said they forgot. This was probably the only bowl of jjajangmyun I never actually finished. It was literally that bad. Never coning here again. Instant jjajangmyun is better. Don't waste your time with this place.
Very good restaurant. Personally like the jjajangmeon. Recommend! The restaurant is clean and k pop music is great as well.
The food was fantastic and the workers were very friendly and welcoming! I highly recommend coming here!

My dad was in the mood for Korean Chinese food, and my trusty yelp app pulled through 

What I ate
- Jjampong: OMG, that broth, so clean, so good, so perfect. It was rich, without being too oily or greasy. You could definitely taste the wok fire flavor in the seafood. Perfect hangover food
- Jja jjang myun: I rarely eat jja jjang myun unless I'm in korea. This was close to korea as I can remember. It was really well made. I was tempted to ask for a bowl of rice so I could finish the rest of the sauce that was leftover. The noodles had a nice bite to them 
- Dumplings: These were just a-ok, nothing special. The filling was tasty, but the dumpling skin was a bit too thick
- Egg drop soup: Being slightly hungover, I just wanted something warm and simple to drink, and this fit the bill. But, nothing overly amazing to write home about

Pros:
- That menu was really beautiful and easy to read for both Korean and Americans. Plenty of beautiful pictures. I also liked that they had a nice variety of options to order from. They had multiple types of jjam pong and jja jjang myun
- Staff was super friendly and checked in on us regularly
- Decor was really cute
- Plenty of seats/tables for small and large parties
- Bathroom was really clean
- Parking was not too bad on a weekday for dinner

Cons:
- They didn't have the traditional chinese soup spoons, just metal spoons. I'm so used to using those chinese soup spoons, that it felt kind of wrong using a metal spoon to eat the soup
- While the decor was cute and super Chinese/Asian, those wooden chairs were SOOOOOO uncomfortable to sit in. Super straight back, no cushion. It was kind of torture!
- I wish they offered a bowl/cup of the jjampong soup. The server was nice enough to offer me one, but I opted for something milder and ordered the egg drop soup instead. I think a small cup of the soup would be a great way to end the meal if you had rice and other dishes
- Sadly, they were very empty. The food and service was so great. I hope they are more on the busy side on the weekends. I was a bit nervous when I first walked in because they were completely empty, but I tried to rationalize it by saying it was a Monday night, kind of on the early side for dinner
- This is such a strange gripe, but I kind of hated the black/dark mirror in the female bathroom. It was really cool to look at, but really difficult to see if I had any red pepper flakes stuck in my teeth after I ate LOL

Would I come again? Yes, next time I'm in town with my parents!

Service, ambiance and food I give 5/5. Spacious seating, clean restaurant, friendly staff, and food came out fast.

So I can't believe I waited this long to try this place as it is so close to my house! Wish I got our servers name because she was pleasant and attentive the entire time. 

Was in time for happy hour which is daily from 9PM-1AM (closing time). Nice selection for happy hour and prices are not bad. $5 for appetizers and $8 for entrees. And definitely come hungry because the portions of everything were generous!

My favorites:
-Fried Dumplings - good starter food, very crunchy
-Gan Jjajang - the black bean sauce was salty but when mixed into the noodles it was just right. So much flavor!
-Stir Fried Mushroom - Again so much flavor in these sauces. Rice is a separate charge but definitely order a bowl if you order this because it is a very wet dish.
-Buchu Jap Chae - comes with 3 buns to eat the pork and veggies with, ugh I'm craving it as I type!

My friends ordered a lot more items but sadly the food coma hit me so early I could not go on lol. But everything I was able to try was seriously delicious. Probably one of the best Asian places I've had in Vegas, and there really isn't that many that stand out for me but I was impressed with this one.

And I'm super freaking happy they are open late because while my sleep schedule is all F'd from working night shift, it's always a struggle to find good late night food that's close by. Great experience overall.

This place was great. I had jjajangmyun, Jjambbong, and tangsuyook. They were great. They tasted as good as what I had in Korea. I could not find good Korean Chinese restaurant in Vegas but this place is it.

Food 
No complaint just had jjajangmyon (Texture of noodle is great) also fried and steam dumpling but I would recommend fried dumpling compared to steamed one.

Service
No complaint, but feel bad for server working alone at the front. 

Etc.
Like some other review mentioned table chair is quite uncomfortable, my legs were pressed against table the whole time.

In this era of generations there's still people look for authentic food , trendy is just a plus now. My family crave for Korean and Chinese we found this place 10 mins. From the house , the setting is nice and clean..
Server was pleasant and patient to explain the menu. 

Apps..Springs rolls,fried dumplings,chicken wings and they gave us crabs ragon for compliments 
Entree's..deep fried shrimp n pork on a garlic chili sauce 
Chicken fried rice and the seafood noodle in a black beans sauce...my family's bellies was very satisfied 

My husband was hard to please but he said " one of the best food he tried " 

Thanks for the meal
I ordered fried rice with jjang jang, it was so good. I liked the atmosphere and really good service. I recommend.
Lunch special offers a very good deal! Sweet and sour pork + 2 Bean Paste Noodles only cost 20!  Will come back to try other noodle dishes.

Yummy! Taste is as good as or better than some chinese restaurants in ktown los angeles. Price is fair too. Great food at a good price, can't go wrong! A little of the strip but worth it for a different, refreshing food choice different from what the strip offers.

This place was incredible! Great food...great service...too bad I woke up from my dream.

 I love good jajiang mein and jampong.  I was so excited about coming here.  This place is disappointingly average.

We ordered jajiang mein, jampong and Gan Peng Ji.

Jajiang mein..sauce average.  Noodle was in one big klump, which means it was sitting there for a while before they brought it out.  In my opinion these noodles should be al dente (as the Italians would say) or QQ ( as the taiwanese would day) or chewy and springy (as Mike K) would say.  You guessed it...these noodles are not. 

Jam Pong.  I got the non spicey since my stomach has betrayed me and I can't eat spicey now.  But even with no spice this broth was excellent.  But the noodles....just like the jajiang mein..has no body or chew.

Gan Peng Ji.  I don't understand all these places that make it with a tomato paste.  It's supposed to be a soy garlic sauce. Here they make it with tomato paste.  Not only is it not good..but really over priced.  Normally korean restaurants give you a big portion of this even if it's not good..but here..small for $14.99.

On the really positive side...really good service..

I stopped here for noodles served in a different way.  The restaurant was almost empty on this early Sunday evening and I was led to an area where I could sit where I wanted.

I was brought iced tea quickly and the server took my order, Jjajangmyeon, a Korean dish of long length noodles with a sauce of black beans and pork.  Before the noodles came, I was brought sides of onion, kimchi, daikon, and a small dish of bean paste.  I was surprised at the mild spice of the kimchi.  Normally, there's more red pepper but this was quite tame.  I added some ground, red pepper to spice it up.

After the noodles came, the server brought me large shears to cut the noodles.  I think this was to help this caucasian eat his noodles easier, much like a mom cuts spaghetti for her youngster.  None of the Asians  in the restaurant were brought such shears.  They worked well and it was easier to eat the noodles so I appreciate her thoughtfulness.  The flavor of the bean sauce with the small pork cubes was very good and it made for a nice change.

I thoroughly enjoyed my visit.  Service was very good and it was good value.  I'd recommend getting the small size unless you intend to share.  It was a good amount of food.
This restaurant has really great food and espeically I recommend Jjajangmyun in this restaurant.

Came here for a quick supper and the food was superb! Ordered the JJajangmyeon or Jajangmyeon and the Fried Dumplings. So far so good. Top notch service and very beautiful/simplistic decor. Can't wait to try dessert.

Food like mom makes ...if you're Korean ! 
Every dish is delicious ....try everything once and I'm sure you'll come back on the regular.

My wife and I stopped by for dinner and we were truly amazed at how good this place was. The staff were very welcoming and attentive. This place was busy but the waiter always managed to check on us and apologize whenever our drinks were near empty. The ambience was very relaxed and the interior design of the place looked great. Pricier than your average Chinese/Korean joint but well worth it.

Good stuff. The portions are huge. I ordered the seafood medium spicy noodle soup and it is REALLY spicy. To the point where I'm not sure if I can finish it. I have to keep pouring soy sauce on the noodles to eat it, lol.

I came here often for lunch and dinner.
I have tried many different food and they all delicious.
My favorite is Jja jang myun.
Everyone should come and try!!!
Enjoy~

It was great time to try Jjampong soup noodle!! 
It was exactly same flavour i tired in Korea. 
Love the place, and thier service was really great and attentive! Will come back again!

First timer, such a booommbb place !!! I would highly recommend !!!! The atmosphere is great, staff are friendly and the food comes out on a timely matter, I didn't even have to wait for more than 10 minutes ! Keep up the hard work

The closest thing I can get to my mom's famous curry and noodles . And it's my mom's approved dish honestly I like this place better than any other place out here in Vegas.. Very flavorful feels like home..

Food is about 4 stars 
Service is about a 1 star 

I was soooooooooooo excited to try this place after seeing all of these noodle pulls on Instagram. I showed my husband and he knows that my love for noodles is ridiculous. So we decided to order to go...they have an online system but it's hard to customize such as no onions and such so we decided to just call. We were able to order with our specifications and the outcome was delish. There's a lot of protein and plenty of noodles when we got it. I would def recommend dining in though just because the seafood does get over cooked when you get it to go unless you live 2 min away. I was excited that I found a noodle place that wasn't the same. 

We came back another time and I had ordered to go on our way there. They told me 30 minutes so by the time we got there we still had 10 minutes left. My husband went inside and he texted me saying that a to go order was ready! That was fast thinking that was ours. Well it turns out that the lady working there said it was NOT our order. He texted me 10 min later saying that he was still waiting. I asked him if we could cancel and he said he already paid since that was the 30 minutes that they had told us. He waited another 10min and that order that was ready when he got there? Yea that was ours! The lady didn't even apologize for making us wait another 20 minutes for food that was all ready ready. Not cool! This experience has left me with a bitter taste in my mouth and I think I'll be skipping this place from now on. Way to go for the bad service and parking kind of stinks there since it's a small lot.

I went twice already since they opened, and I actually love their portion, price and flavor of their food. Their yang jang pi does lack in some seafood and veggies, but it was still tasty. The jja jang myun is served in a perfect portion and it is not too strong in taste or msg flavor that makes me drink a lot of water afterwards. I hope the service gets a little more prompt, but the servers were still very nice and attentive, so I think it is something that will get better as they settle down. I am just so glad that there is a korean chinese fusion restaurant open in SW area!

Excited to try this place out cuz I love jja jjang myun. Clean place, bigger than I'd thought it'd be. Food, however, was very disappointing. Ordered jja jjang myun and yusansuel. Yusansuel is vastly different from what I'm used to from other Korean Chinese restaurants. Seems it's been tailored for Western taste buds. I didn't like it and neither did my friend. Jja jjang myun was bland. Overall not very good. Wouldn't recommend.
I've never eaten at the restaurant but did get jajang to go. It's probably the best authentic jajangmun you can get in Vegas!! Highly recommended!!
Great place if your craving Korean Chinese cuisine.   The jjampong and jjajjangmyun was not up to par for me.  But still good.

I was quite happy with our experience at this restaurant today.  From the outside I thought it would be a  hole-in-the-wall, however I could not have been more wrong.  The inside was well decorated and clean.  I should also mention that from the outside it was hard to tell the restaurant was open.  The staff was extremely nice and helpful.  

We got our food and it tasted great.  My personal selection was quite limited since I don't like seafood (it is in many of their entrees).  Still the seafood-free noodle dish I ordered was delicious as was my husbands fried chicken dish. 

This restaurant is a. Chinese/Korean place so the style and spice level of the food would probably be more familiar to people unfamiliar with Korean cuisine.  This would make it ideal for bringing my less adventurous friends to introduce them to Korean fare for the first or second time. 

I would come back to this restaurant and would gladly recommend it to my friends.

It was our first time here. Hubby and i went for lunch on a Saturday and it wasn't busy at all.  We really didn't know what to get so we ended up just getting the Samseon Jjamppong with white sauce, which had absolutely no heat. My husband liked it, where for me, I'd definitely like to try the soup with heat. I was surprised that I really liked this soup. The noodles were delicious and the broth had a miso color to it since there were no peppers. The seafood was cooked perfectly. 
We weren't offered tea but had to wait a bit when we did ask for it. I believe the hot water machine that boiled the water wasn't working or something so they had to boil the water some other way. When they brought the tea out, the little kettle that they gave us leaked when we poured the tea so we got water all over the table. 
We were never asked if we wanted anything else, instead the male server automatically asked if we wanted the check so my husband just said yes. I guess we're just used to other restaurants where they ask if you'd be interested in dessert. 
All in all, I'm sure we'll be back to try the other entrees since it's fairly close to our house and we don't have to drive all the way to Chinatown.

Oodles of noodles!

Alejandro B. and myself took a drive all the way from the north side of town for some YuXiang. I was tired of @LasVegasPhil posting his scrumptious looking bowls of freshly made noodles every other week, so I went to see what the fuss was all about. The interior is very new and clean with fancy designed booths for extra privacy. Luckily, we had the privilege to sit in them since it was a little slow.

Our server was very nice... and pretty;) We were given suggestions for our orders to make sure we were completely satisfied. Too bad she didn't have a name tag or I would be able to express my creepy gratitude a little more Lol. Alex took one for the team and got their Jjamppong (spicy seafood noodle soup) while I played it safe with the Samseon Gan Jjajang (seafood pork vegetables with black bean sauce). Both had it's own unique flavor being sweet or spicy. We balanced out all the carbs with some crisp Spicy Wings that weren't very hot, but packed great flavor. 

Overall, I was satisfied with my first visit at XuYiang. I will have to come back to try more of their authentic Korean/Chinese entrees.
My favorite new korean- chinese restaurant. Staffs are super friendly. Authentic chinese food. Must try Jjajang noodle,and Jjamppong. Honey walnut shrimp, pork and beef tangsuyuk.
Good authentic korean food. Black bean noodles and my kids fav garlic pork. Service is good, and our server helped us a lot.

I come here with my daughter on a regular basis. She loves the steamed dumplings here. The portion here in my opinion is quite generous, and definitely sharable. The noodles here are excellent, I am normally someone who likes to stick with ordering the same thing at restaurants, but I usually like to order different things here because I trust it won't fail me. Being in the hospitality business, I definitely feel that my business is valued here, and welcomed.

Awesome spicy seafood and noodle soup! Sweet and sour pork dish is perfect. Love how they separate the sauce from the pork. Service is excellent and ambiance is equally nice. Overall, this place is excellent.
I visited in YuXiang on last Friday. And it was good taste (beef tangsuyuk, jiajangmyun). Also surver's survives was good. I will visit again!!

To me, this restaurant seems considerably overpriced.  Maybe I will feel better about eating in next time instead of getting takeout though.  

Mapo Tofu was weird, like a cornstarch-thickened sweet tomato soup, lightly spicy, with almost nonexistent meat.  I like the Mapo Tofu at Grand Sign Kitchen nearby a lot more, they use bigger shreds of pork than any of my dishes here had, bigger tofu, less and different sauce.  

Could barely tell the difference between the $11 Japchaebap and $19 Gochu Japchae, the more expensive one was in a different container but the portion looked pretty much the same.  The pork is cut tissue-thin.  For the amount of cost, every entree should come with side dishes, not just 1 set of tiny tubs for the whole order.  The flavoring on everything was very mild (which may be to your taste).  On the plus side, everything tasted fresh and light, no 'old oil' taste.  Every dish we ordered has lots of onions to make the portions look bigger and one of the side dishes is onions.  Perhaps I would enjoy one of the fried pork dishes more, or soup.  I feel like this place has potential to be better.

I ordered Jja Jang myun, Jjam Bong, and Tang su yuk.
However, Jja jang myun was terrible because too much water and not normal taste. It looks like JJa jang soup.
Also, their server was not friendly.
I think they need to improve their food and service.
I will visit to them again soon.

Finally a Korean-chinese restaurant! We love Korean food & we love chinese food. So hearing about this place got me all excited! When we got the chinese portion of our order, and we were glad to have ordered them. I thought the prices were descent :) We also ordered Korean food so we can get the best of both world. Unfortunately we were very disappointed with that part. The food lacked flavor and seasoning. 
3 stars for the chinese food that we ordered and 5 stars for the service! They were very attentive

First off, this place offers a free eggroll, ice cream or soda for a yelp review..so i wasn't sure how accurate the reviews we're for this place when reading the reviews prior to coming. But decided to give it a try...

Being korean, I was craving for some good korean chinese food. Found this place and thought I'd give it a try. Korean chinese foods most popular dishes are jjajangmyun, jjampong, and tangsuyuk.

I ordered their lunch special which had all 3 of the dishes I listed above. And it only costs $23.95..which ia a pretty good deal for all the food you get...but the food was a major disappointment. 

First tangsuyuk came out. It was crispy on the outside, meaty on the inside. However, i don't think they seasoned the meat prior to cooking. The tangsuyuk sauce was given on the side (which is to help the meat be crispier). Sauce was not good. It was a bit watery than the usually ones I've had else where and it had a strange taste to it. Also a bit bland. Usually the sauce should be a little thick than watery. 

Second the jjajangmyun. Consists of noodles with a black bean sauce poured on top. You mix it all together and eat. Sauce was wayy too overly sweet for me and also watery. Sauce should also be somewhat thick but it wasn't. 

Third item is the jjampong. It's a spicy seafood noodles. This had a kick of spiciness which i loved. Noodles were cooked well, but the soup could have used a bit more flavor. 

Overall i was not blown away. Everything was just too bland for me. I probably won't ever return.

We were not in the mood for a traditional Thanksgiving meal so I contacted a number of non casino restaurants to find one that would be open on the holiday evening.  YuXiang responded in the affirmative.  On entering, I was struck by the attractive dining room though it was less than half full that evening.  We started off with a pair of chicken eggrolls that were very light and flavorful. We also were served a couple of banchan's that were not particularly noteworthy.  My wife ordered Jjangmyeon noodles (noodles topped with a thick sauce made of Korean black bean paste ((Chunjang)), diced pork and vegetables).  It proved to bountiful and initially tasted wonderful, but it became a bit of a one note and probably should have been shared by 2-3 people.  I chose Samseon Jjampaong, a spicy seafood noodle soup that included black mussels, whole shrimp and overcooked calamari in a broth that included garlic and Korean red pepper.  It was just okay, but not one I would order again.
One of the very few jjajang myun and jjampongplaces in Vegas that's edible. Not the best but pretty good

This place is a great spot to get Korean Chinese food without driving down to Spring Mountain. 

My parents are Chinese born in Korea and my dad makes the best jjajang but I have to say, even him and my mom enjoyed this place. 

We got a few dishes - such as the mixed vegetables, meat, seafood, on top of noodles and mustard sauce ($27 - can't remember the name) but very delicious. My mom felt like her craving for it was satisfied. We also enjoyed the 6 seafood combo with rice ($15) and the seafood gan jjajang ($11). I thought the gan jjajang was just short of how salty I like it though but it still satisfied my cravings! 

The place was well decorated and not too big or small. It was clean - the servers were sweet and the food came out at a very adequate and appropriate speed. 

Next time, I will get the champong and definitely tangsuyuk (sweet & sour pork)! I really enjoyed the gan jjajang and had some left over that I will be enjoying over rice. I also bet their traditional jjajangmyun is delicious (prob a better option for take out or delivery since gan jjajang is meant to be enjoyed fresh in the restaurant). There are also many different Korean Chinese dishes that I bet are tasty. 

Check this gem on the SW out! It's in the same parking lot as Goong KBBQ, Dairy Queen, etc.

This place is super cute. I'm in love with the decor.
The service is nice too. They really try to pay attention.
I feel like I haven't had good jajjangmyun in a while. The onions were as soft as a potato, perfect. (:
My new go to Korean Chinese. 
Will be bringing my mom lol.

Their lunch special is pretty good. Since it's relatively a new restaurant, there never a long wait. I remember that Yuxiang used to have really bad reviews on their service, and I can see improvement  since last time.
The jjampong and tangsooyook was delicious. The jja jjangmyun however was a bit off in flavor, too light. Won't be going back.
Felt good about our decision to eat here. Right off the bat  I was impressed with the decor and cleanliness. Friendly staff and good service. Really enjoyed the orange chicken.
Last time I was here I had horrible service and couple months I crave for black noodles and the service was good, our food was faster than the last time and service was better will come back again.
Good flavor, noodles fresh, great prices, decor nice, service polite, prices for jjangjang were excellent for the portion. Good job.
This place is really good. I really like their spicy seafood noodles and their pork fried rice. I would recommend this place if you want some Korean style Chinese food.

This is probably the best korean chinese place I've been to in vegas. Granted I've only been to 2 others ( island style and the food court at Greenland). This place is pretty cute inside. Some might say overdecorated and cliche but it's unique to vegas at least. The decor is stereotypical Beijing chic. 

For the two of us we ordered jampong (seafood soup) with no noodles, jajangmein (black bean noodle) and tonsiu yuk ( fried pork). The jampong is super spicy. If you're not into spicy foods I would avoid this because it definitely has a kick. It doesn't have as much seafood as other places but the broth is stronger and more flavorful. 

The black bean noodle was good. It's not too salty and the flavor is mild. The tong Siu yuk was really good. The quality of the meat was much better than anywhere I've had it. It's lean pork meat with not too much batter and the sauce added sweet and vinegary notes to the dish.

Their food was amazing!! We had jjamppong and jjajangmyun. It was so good!! It was way better than any other Korean Chinese restaurant in town. I wasn't expecting a lot but oh man they exceeded the expectation. Love their interior and atmosphere. The service was exceptionally good. The servers were all nice. We were greeted when we first got there and they constantly checked on our table and made sure we were okay with everything. I would definitely recommend this place and we will be back for more jjajangmyun!!
Amazing food! Food comes out fast and is accompanied with great sides. Service is prompt and friendly. Really good service.

Got there last week with my girlfriend. We were seated, but happened that the seat was reserved for someone else. They apologized and asked us if we can sit elsewhere. We really did not mind, because our couple work for customers also; Everyone makes mistakes. We were been seated on the other spot, and one of our server insisted to give us complimentary fried dumpling. We really did not mind switching the seat, because it is not a single big deal, but... Well okay..? It is free so I will take it. The server was Stephen I think. While we were ordering, we asked him to see if we can get some jjambbong soup by itself as a complimentary. Stephen told us he won't be able to guarantee us that he is able to give us jjambbong soup, but he will try best, and gave us an alternatives egg soups instead, if it is in that case. Which was great, amazing. Food was great, nothing special, but we enjoyed our time. jjambbong soup came out a bit late, but we were okay. Stephen apologized for being so late, but I really did not mind, because we were not that tricky and jjambbong soup was something that was not guaranteed like what he mentioned earlier. When our check came out and paid with our credit card, I don't know why, but gratuity line has been already filled with $0. I believed that he felt apologized, so he decided not to take gratuity from us since he thought that he did not serve us well. I was embarrassed, because I have never seen as attentive server as him, and he tried his best on what he could to please us. And we decided to just pay gratuity with cash. I believe we have dropped around 20% of the gratuity. 

Again, great place to eat when I am into Korean style Chinese food. It was great experience for us, and we never thought that we've been treated badly, everything was good.

Went here for lunch today. Been wanting to try this place because one of my favorite food is black bean noodles. I also saw that they had sweet and sour pork. 
Arriving here their were a few tables occupied. No one greeted us at the door until after a couple of minutes. A young man pointed us to a booth and left. We waited a little over 5 minutes for the same man who I come and check on us and realized we didn't have menus. The menu is separated by categories which was easy to read and understand. Before arriving I knew I wanted to try their black bean noodles and sweet and sour pork. Luckily it was on their lunch special. We got the second to the last lunch special because it included the sweet and sour pork, black bean noodle and their spicy seafood soup with noodles. 
The first dish was the sweet sour pork. They brought it out with the sauce on the side. Which I prefer because I like my pork to be and stay crispy. The sauce and vegetables was good. It's not the typical red or pink sauce that most places will have. All in all I would rate I a 7/10. 
The black bean noodles was the second dish I tried. Honestly, this flavor was underwhelming. I felt that the noodles were over cooked and the sauce needed more flavor. I would rather eat the ones from Greenland market's food court noodles. 5/10
Spicy seafood noodle soup was spicy. I wish I knew to ask for a mild one. I did like it. Never had it before so didn't know what to compare it to. The only downside was the seafood was a little overcooked.
